abstracts.cdata!:
The specific objective of the West
            Africa Pilot Community-Based Natural Resource and Wildlife
            Management Project is to conserve biodiversity through local
            community participation in capacity building and human
            resource development, zoning wildland and village areas,
            improving natural habitat and wildlife management, and
            improving agricultural land management and infrastructure
            development. Segmented into four main objectives the project
            seeks to: 1) strengthen the capacity of local communities,
            nongovernmental organizations and government to manage wild
            plant and animal resources in a sustainable manner; 2) to
            improve the managmement and use of habitat and wildlife
            populations at each site; 3) to improve local land
            management practices and infrastructure; and 4) to establish
            a durable system for monitoring and evaluating project
            implementation and impact. There are four components to
            achieve this objective: support for local-level capacity
            building; implementation of habitat and wildlife management
            measures; land management and infrastructure development;
            and project management.
